inventory.commentary: Note: WordNet sense 7 omitted; proper name 'Leontyne Price'

sense.name: cost or monetary value of goods or services
sense.examples: The price of gasoline has soured in recent months. I don't know the prices of these two fur coats. The museum would not sell its Dutch Masters collection for any price. The cattle thief has a price on his head in three states. They say that every politician has a price.

sense.name: sacrifice or toll required to achieve something
sense.examples: John has paid a high price for his risky life style. The army is paying a significant price in casualties to occupy the city. The price of fame was more than Mary imagined.
